item.title: [562][RS2HD] Combat
item.dc:creator: @Native1 Native^
item.description:
@Native1 wrote:

like onix said; start with the packet. that packet is the attack option on a player (not sure what packet), there you could make a method like [font=courier]player.attack(otherPlayer)[/font] where you get the otherPlayer variable by getting the player from the player array (or list, or whatever your way of handling players is) with the playerId variable (which you can get from the packet buffer.)

in that method you can deal with the real work. but setup the basics first.

item.title: [562][RS2HD] Combat
item.dc:creator: @Onix Onix
item.description:
@Onix wrote:

I think you should drop everything you are thinking about and start from the bottom with the basics. Start off with a simple combat handler. All you need to start is the packet id’s I think. Write up a few combat cases and slowly progress to the level you want it add.

Don’t try to jump into the deep-end with this and try and write the full combat system in one sweep, because that is bound to fail.
